Event Title: Path to Employment-Starting Your Job Search
Description: An in-depth Orientation that includes a discussion of the emotional impact of job loss, and setting effective career goals. Traditional work search methods and how to develop job search plans are also discussed.
Location 1:
Sussex County Mall, Route 206 North
Newton, NJ 07860-1818

Description: The use of branding, marketing yourself, and the importance of having a competent resume is discussed. Participants will see the advantages and disadvantages of different resume formats, and review the basic elements of an effective resume and cover letter.

Event Title: TOMAHAWK LAKE WATERPARK SUMMER JOB FAIR
Description:
Hiring up to 50 positions for:

Guest Services, Lifeguards, Ride & Boat Dispatchers, Parking, Snack Bar, Ice Cream attendants, Catering Workers, Park Services, Cleaning, Maintenance and more...Jobs for all!

  • Must be age 15 or older
  • Retirees & Seniors Welcome
  • No Experience necessary
  • Drug Free Workplace
  • 2 Forms ID-Social Security Card & Passport or Drivers License(Photo ID)... Birth Certificate and working papers if under age 18

Bring a friend/family
Do not miss out on these great job Opportunities!
Adecco will be conducting Interviews at
Kolmar, 20 West King Street, Port Jervis, NY
Wednesday, March 14, 2018
10:00 am to 2:00 pm

Please bring 2 forms of ID and previous work history.

We're proud to partner with Kolmar for production jobs in Port Jervis, NY.

Responsibilities include:
- Assemble make up and personal care products
- Package product
- Working in a team environment
Requirements include:
- Drug Screen and Background Check
- Ability to be accurate in a fast paced environment
- Previous experience in manufacturing is not required
Why work for Kolmar?
- 1st and 2nd Shifts available
- Temporary to hire opportunities
- Overtime Opportunity
- No heavy lifting
- $10.40/hour
Come and see us or visit Adeccousa.com for an online application! Please bring 2 forms of valid ID and work history!

Event Title: Devereux Advanced Behavioral Health  Job Fair
Description:
Devereux Advanced Behavioral Health, the largest behavioral healthcare organization in the nation, is hosting an interview day for open Direct Support Professional roles in group homes for the developmentally disabled.

A qualified candidate will be 18 years or older, possess a Valid Driver's License, and have a minimum of a HS diploma/GED.  Experience working with the developmentally disabled population, as a CNA/ Home Health Aide or personal/volunteer experience with this population is preferred, but not required.

Qualified candidates will receive on the spot interviews with hiring managers.

What to bring:

Please bring your resume and valid Driver's License

Can't Attend???  Please apply online at jobs.devereux.org.

Join us in this very important work we do supporting youth. You¿ll have the opportunity to make a positive difference in the lives of others. We invite you to explore career opportunities at New Jersey MENTOR on Monday, June 4th. During our Hiring Event, you will be able to speak directly with hiring managers and MENTOR staff members.

We have the following opportunities:

¿ Youth Support Specialists (Direct Care)
¿ Registered Nurse
¿ Group Home Managers
¿ Assistant Group Home Managers)
¿ Therapists
¿ Foster Parent Recruiter

Please bring a resume and be prepared to complete an employment application. Come join us at the following location:

Dover Community Center
37 N Essex Road
Dover, NJ 07801
Monday, June 4th ¿ 11:00am to 4:00pm

We have a history of growth from within ¿ our staff have the opportunity to build challenging and rewarding careers across multiple functions, service lines and locations. 

Full time, part time and on-call positions are available. Evenings and Weekend shifts allow schedules to fit around school, other employment, or family commitments. 

Work locations we're hiring for in NJ: Somerset, Hackettstown, Great Meadows Stanhope, Bayville, Millstone, Ewing, Howell, Freehold, Manalapan.

For more information, please contact Eva Black, Talent Recruiter at Eva.Black@thementornetwork.com or visit www.nj-mentor.com

Event Title: Basic Computer Skills: Intro to Computers
Description:
Your Path to Employment: Basic Computer Skills 

As a job seeker in today¿s market, you must have some basic computer knowledge to search and apply for jobs. This six session, informational course teaches different aspects of computer literacy as they relate to finding and attaining employment. Each class has a different focus, and you may register for all classes or just those that best suit your needs.

Session 1, Intro to Computers
September 19 @ Dennis Library in Newton. 
Find the power button, understand the keyboard and use the mouse.

Separate registration is required for each class and has already begun. Library laptops will be available for use on a first-come, first-served basis.

An overview of the interview process, including how to prepare for the interview; and what to expect during each phase of the interview process. How to follow up after the conclusion of the interview is also reviewed.

Event Title: Path to Employment-Starting Your Job Search
Description: An in-depth Orientation that includes a discussion of the emotional impact of job loss, and setting effective career goals. Traditional work search methods and how to develop job search plans are also discussed.

The use of branding, marketing yourself, and the importance of having a competent resume is discussed. Participants will see the advantages and disadvantages of different resume formats, and review the basic elements of an effective resume and cover letter. Participants will learn the advantages of targeting custom resumes for a specific employer, job openings and/or industry. Topics will also include how to detail accomplishments, achievements, and develop an effective summary/profile. A discussion of a using a professional cover letter and references is included as well.

Event Title: Devereux Advanced Behavioral Health  Job Fair
Description:
Devereux Advanced Behavioral Health, the largest behavioral healthcare organization in the nation, is hosting an interview day for open direct support professional roles in group homes for the developmentally disabled. A qualified candidate will be 18 years or older, possess a Current, Non-Provisional Driver's License, valid in the State of New Jersey, and have a minimum of a HS diploma/GED.  Experience working with the developmentally disabled population, as a CNA/ Home Health Aide, or personal or volunteer experience with this population is preferred, but not required. Qualified candidates will receive on the spot interviews with hiring managers.

Please bring your resume and Current,  Non-Provisional Driver's License, valid in the State of New Jersey.

Can't Attend???  Please apply online at jobs.devereux.org.

Including how to follow up after the conclusion of the interview. Come join us in the very important work we do supporting youth.  Our team is fun, creative, and dedicated to making a difference every day in the lives of the people we serve. We invite you to explore career opportunities at New Jersey MENTOR on Friday, February 2, 2018. During our Hiring Day, you will be able to speak directly with hiring managers and MENTOR staff members. 

We have opportunities in the following areas:
          Youth Support Specialists (Direct Care)
	  Group Home Managers

Please bring a resume and be prepared to complete an employment application.  Come join us at the following location:

New Jersey Mentor
23 Waterloo Road
Stanhope, NJ 07874
Friday, February 2nd - 10am to 7:00pm
 
Work locations we're hiring for in NJ:  Stanhope, Hackettstown, Lafayette, Great Meadows, Hampton, Somerset

Full time, part time and on-call positions are available. Evenings and Weekend shifts allow schedules to fit around school, other employment, or family commitments. 

For more information, please contact Eva Black, Talent Recruiter at Eva.Black@thementornetwork.com or visit www.nj-mentor.com

Event Title: Basic Computer Skills: Intro to Microsoft Word
Description:
Your Path to Employment: Basic Computer Skills 

As a job seeker in today¿s market, you must have some basic computer knowledge to search and apply for jobs. This six session, informational course teaches different aspects of computer literacy as they relate to finding and attaining employment. Each class has a different focus, and you may register for all classes or just those that best suit your needs.

Session 3, Intro to Microsoft Word
October 3rd @ Dennis Library in Newton. 
Overview of all the Office programs with a focus on using Word to create, save and edit documents.

Recruiting for substitute school personnel including teachers and school aides for Morris County and surrounding districts.

QuickChek is now hiring at a location near you. Applicants should be friendly, enjoy working in a fast-paced, team environment and be available to work one weekend day on a regular basis as well as most holidays. We offer competitive starting pay, flexible scheduling, growth and career opportunities along with benefits. Positions include Team Members for cashiering and/or food service, Gas Attendants, and Store Manager Trainees.

Please visit our website, www.QuickChekJobs.com to complete an online application prior to attending. Resumes are a welcome addition along with a great attitude!


QuickChek is proud to be one of NJ's and NY's Best Places to Work! With over 4,000 team members in over 150 stores, we strive to create a positive experience and fun environment where core values are nurtured, hard work is rewarded and leadership is cultivated.

Full time, part time and on-call positions are available. Evenings and Weekend shifts allow schedules to fit around school, other employment, or family commitments.

Work locations we're hiring for in NJ:  Bayville, Millstone, Ewing, Howell, Freehold, Manalapan, Somerset, Lafayette, Hampton, Milford, Hackettstown, Great Meadows, Stanhope

For more information, please contact Eva Black, Talent Recruiter at Eva.Black@thementornetwork.com or visit www.nj-mentor.com

Event Title: Path to Employment-Starting Your Job Search
Description: An in-depth Orientation that includes a discussion of the emotional impact of job loss, and setting effective career goals. Traditional work search methods and how to develop job search plans are also discussed.

The use of branding, marketing yourself, and the importance of having a competent resume is discussed. Participants will see the advantages and disadvantages of different resume formats, and review the basic elements of an effective resume and cover letter. Participants will learn the advantages of targeting custom resumes for a specific employer, job openings and/or industry. Topics will also include how to detail accomplishments, achievements, and develop an effective summary/profile. A discussion of a using a professional cover letter and references is included as well.

Event Title: Basic Computer Skills: The Internet and Email
Description:
Your Path to Employment: Basic Computer Skills 

As a job seeker in today¿s market, you must have some basic computer knowledge to search and apply for jobs. This six session, informational course teaches different aspects of computer literacy as they relate to finding and attaining employment. Each class has a different focus, and you may register for all classes or just those that best suit your needs.

Session 2, The Internet and Email 
September 26 @ Dennis Library in Newton. 
Search engines, setting up and accessing email, basic browsing and email security.

Separate registration is required for each class and has already begun. Library laptops will be available for use on a first-come, first-served basis.

Build on the topics covered in the Basic Resume workshop. In addition to the different resume formats and basic layouts, participants will see the advantages of targeting custom resumes for a specific employer, job openings and/or industry. Topics will also include how to detail accomplishments, achievements, and develop an effective summary/profile. A discussion of a using a professional cover letter and references is included as well.
Jobseekers can get information on various training opportunities including federal grants, tuition waivers and basic computer skills. Call to register.

Including how to follow up after the conclusion of the interview.
